channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CAMEL-11668] CompositeApiClient class in the camel-salesforces component cannot close a null InputStream
item.description:
In the class DefaultCompositeApiClient.java the method
<T> Optional<T> tryToReadResponse(final Class<T> expectedType, final InputStream responseStream)
cannot handle a null InputStream.
item.environment: Windows 10, Eclipse Oxygen IDE with Java J2SE
item.summary: CompositeApiClient class in the camel-salesforces component cannot close a null InputStream

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The problem can be resolved by checking if the responseStream is null or not before closing the Stream.

GitHub user DG007 opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/camel/pull/1886

Camel 2.19.x

CAMEL-11668: CompositeApiClient class in the camel-salesforces component cannot close a null InputStream

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/apache/camel camel-2.19.x

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/camel/pull/1886.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #1886
